common_issues.title: Pieces OS fails to launch after update
common_issues.description: Users are reporting that the Pieces OS desktop application gets stuck during startup after an update. This issue appears on both Windows and MacOS, and the app hangs on the "dependencies scenario". Rebooting doesn't solve the problem. The Pieces team is investigating data migration as a potential cause and suggests allowing the app time to finish this process.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue #613: Pieces OS fails to launch, stuck in "dependencies scenario"

**Key Points Raised:**

* The application is stuck on the "dependencies scenario" and does not progress.
* This issue happens on both Windows and MacOS platforms.
* The issue appears to be related to a major migration of data that occurs when upgrading to PiecesOS 11.1.0.
* Rebooting the PiecesOS Desktop application or the entire system does not resolve the issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* The application hangs indefinitely on startup.
* Users are unable to access or use the application.
* The root cause of the issue is not clear.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* PiecesOS team is actively investigating the issue and working on a resolution.
* Users are advised to allow the application some time to complete the data migration process.
* PiecesOS team offers to schedule calls with users to diagnose the issue further.
* Reinstalling the application or using the appInstaller build may help in some cases.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still under investigation.
* PiecesOS team is actively communicating with affected users and providing updates.

**Additional Notes:**

* rogierlegit, the original poster, is experiencing the issue on MacOS Monterey.
* Shamas-Habib is experiencing the issue on Windows.
* Other users are also reporting the same issue on various platforms.

## Conclusion

The PiecesOS team is aware of the issue and is working on a resolution. Users are advised to allow the application some time to complete the data migration process or to contact the PiecesOS team for further assistance.

recommendations: **Investigate and resolve the 'Pieces OS fails to launch after update' issue:** This is the most common issue with 2 reported cases and high activity levels on related tickets. Resolving this should significantly reduce support volume.

**Improve communication around updates:** Provide clear instructions to users on what to expect during and after updates, including potential wait times for data migration. This could prevent similar issues in the future.
**Gather more information on the 'localhost' error:** Ticket #617 lacks details. Encourage users to provide more context and steps to reproduce the issue for faster resolution.
**Monitor ticket activity:** Continue tracking activity levels on tickets to identify and prioritize emerging issues or trends.
